title: Why I'm done trying to be "man enough" - Justin Baldoni

multiple-choice.question: What is the main point that the speaker wants to convey about the definition of masculinity?

options.label: A
options.text: That men should only be strong and tough.

options.label: B
options.text: That men should be sensitive and emotional.

options.label: C
options.text: That the traditional definition of masculinity is toxic and needs to change.

options.label: D
options.text: That men should only be brave and confident.

multiple-choice.question: Why did the speaker feel a sense of shame and guilt about his behavior towards his wife?

options.label: A
options.text: Because he was being too loud and dominant.

options.label: B
options.text: Because he was cutting off his wife's conversations and not listening to her.

options.label: C
options.text: Because he was not being vulnerable and open with his emotions.

options.label: D
options.text: Because he was not being sensitive and empathetic towards his wife.

multiple-choice.question: What is the quote from the Bahá'í writings that the speaker mentions, and what does it mean?

options.label: A
options.text: "The world of humanity is possessed of two wings, the male and the female. So long as these two wings are not equivalent in strength, the bird will not fly." This means that men and women should be equal in strength and ability.

options.label: B
options.text: "The world of humanity is possessed of two wings, the male and the female. So long as these two wings are not equivalent in strength, the bird will not fly." This means that men and women should work together to achieve their goals.

options.label: C
options.text: "The world of humanity is possessed of two wings, the male and the female. So long as these two wings are not equivalent in strength, the bird will not fly." This means that men and women should respect and appreciate each other's differences.

options.label: D
options.text: "The world of humanity is possessed of two wings, the male and the female. So long as these two wings are not equivalent in strength, the bird will not fly." This means that men should be in charge and women should follow.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's challenge to men, and what does he want them to do?

options.label: A
options.text: He wants men to be more aggressive and dominant, and to take charge of their relationships.

options.label: B
options.text: He wants men to be more sensitive and emotional, and to listen to and respect women's feelings and opinions.

options.label: C
options.text: He wants men to redefine what it means to be a man, and to use their strength and bravery to explore their hearts and be more vulnerable.

options.label: D
options.text: He wants men to be more traditional and follow the old definition of masculinity.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's message to parents, and what does he want them to teach their children?

options.label: A
options.text: He wants parents to teach their children to be brave and confident, and to fit into traditional gender roles.

options.label: B
options.text: He wants parents to teach their children to be good humans, and to value and respect each other's differences.

options.label: C
options.text: He wants parents to teach their children to be sensitive and emotional, and to prioritize their feelings and well-being.

options.label: D
options.text: He wants parents to teach their children to be strong and tough, and to take charge of their relationships.

title: How to narrate your life story

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the difference between despair and hope?

options.label: A
options.text: Despair is about the past, while hope is about the future.

options.label: B
options.text: Despair is about the present, while hope is about the future.

options.label: C
options.text: Despair is about telling a story of failure, while hope is about telling a story of success.

options.label: D
options.text: Despair is about telling a story of meaningless, while hope is about telling a story of meaning.

multiple-choice.question: What is the task that a small number of people self-consciously do, but is actually a universal activity?

options.label: A
options.text: Writing our autobiographies.

options.label: B
options.text: Writing our stories in our minds.

options.label: C
options.text: Narrating our life stories.

options.label: D
options.text: Telling our stories to others.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is a characteristic of harsh narrators of life stories?

options.label: A
options.text: They are overly optimistic.

options.label: B
options.text: They are overly critical.

options.label: C
options.text: They are overly generous.

options.label: D
options.text: They are overly harsh.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a good storyteller and a harsh narrator, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: A good storyteller takes credit for all successes, while a harsh narrator blames others for all failures.

options.label: B
options.text: A good storyteller recognizes that we are not always responsible for everything that happens to us, while a harsh narrator overpersonalizes every event.

options.label: C
options.text: A good storyteller tells a story of failure, while a harsh narrator tells a story of success.

options.label: D
options.text: A good storyteller tells a story of meaninglessness, while a harsh narrator tells a story of meaning.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the main goal of developing emotional intelligence?

options.label: A
options.text: To become a better storyteller.

options.label: B
options.text: To develop a more balanced and kinder way of narrating our life stories.

options.label: C
options.text: To become a more successful person.

options.label: D
options.text: To become a more critical person.

title: An Exercise in Self Compassion

options.text: It causes people to become overly dependent on others.

options.text: It results in a loss of creativity and innovation.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To promote a more kindly and compassionate perspective on setbacks and failures.

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: Luck is solely the result of individual effort and hard work.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Luck is only relevant in extreme circumstances.

options.label: D
options.text: Luck is not a relevant concept in modern society.

options.label: C
options.text: To focus solely on material success and status.

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore the problem and hope it goes away.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They are essential for a good, ambitious, and fruitful life.

options.label: C
options.text: They are only relevant for individuals who are struggling with mental health issues.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only relevant for individuals who are wealthy and successful.

title: Mom vs. dad: What did you inherit?

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why male red-green colour blindness is more common than in females?

options.label: A
options.text: Females have two X chromosomes, while males have only one.

options.label: B
options.text: Males inherit the X chromosome from their father, while females inherit it from their mother.

options.label: C
options.text: Males only inherit one X chromosome from their mother, which carries the gene for red-green colour blindness.

options.label: D
options.text: Females are more likely to pass on the gene for red-green colour blindness to their children.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Allelic imbalance

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic dominance

options.label: D
options.text: Epigenetic inheritance

options.text: Because they were worried about disappointing their mother.

options.text: Because they felt like they were not being true to themselves.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: That women's writing has been suppressed throughout history.

options.label: C
options.text: That women's experiences are not worth exploring in literature.

options.label: D
options.text: That women's writing is inferior to men's writing.

options.label: B
options.text: Postmodernism

options.label: C
options.text: Realism

options.label: D

options.text: The use of traditional narrative structures.

options.label: B
options.text: The use of stream of consciousness and interior monologue.

options.label: C
options.text: The focus on external events rather than internal experiences.

options.label: D
options.text: The use of simple, straightforward language.

options.label: B
options.text: "To the Lighthouse"

options.label: C
options.text: "The Waves"

options.label: D
options.text: "Orlando"

options.label: C
options.text: It uses a traditional third-person narrative voice.

options.label: D
options.text: It features a non-linear narrative structure with multiple timelines.

options.label: D

title: How to teach kids to talk about taboo topics - Liz Kleinrock

multiple-choice.question: What was the response of the teacher when a student asked, "Why are some people racist?" and another student replied, "Maybe some people don't like black people because their skin is the color of poop"?

options.label: A
options.text: The teacher reprimanded the student for saying something wildly funny.

options.label: B
options.text: The teacher changed the subject and quickly started reaching for another subject.

options.label: C
options.text: The teacher said, "Actually, Abby makes a point."

options.label: D
options.text: The teacher ignored the comment and continued with the lesson.

multiple-choice.question: According to the teacher, what is one reason why racism exists?

options.label: A
options.text: Because people with dark skin are stronger than people with light skin.

options.label: B
options.text: Because people with light skin have looked at people with dark skin and said that their skin was ugly.

options.label: C
options.text: Because people with dark skin are more intelligent than people with light skin.

options.label: D
options.text: Because people with light skin are more powerful than people with dark skin.

multiple-choice.question: What is the teacher's approach to teaching kids about equity in schools?

options.label: A
options.text: The teacher starts by giving students books to read about equity and inclusion.

options.label: B
options.text: The teacher breaks down words into letters and sounds and encourages students to practice their fluency by reading every single day.

options.label: C
options.text: The teacher starts by giving students a survey about different issues around equity and inclusion.

options.label: D
options.text: The teacher starts by lecturing students about the importance of equity and inclusion.

multiple-choice.question: What is the teacher's approach to admitting when they don't know the answer to a student's question?

options.label: A
options.text: The teacher pretends to be an expert in the subject and gives a fake answer.

options.label: B
options.text: The teacher tells the student that they're too young to ask such a question.

options.label: C
options.text: The teacher admits that they don't know the answer and encourages the student to ask the question to a representative of a nonprofit.

options.label: D
options.text: The teacher ignores the question and moves on to another topic.

multiple-choice.question: What did the students in the teacher's class say when asked what they would say to adults who think they're too young to learn about issues of equity?

options.label: A
options.text: They said that they're not capable of having these conversations and that it's not their responsibility.

options.label: B
options.text: They said that they're too young to learn about issues of equity and that it's not relevant to their lives.

options.label: C
options.text: They said that they view it as a right and not as a privilege and that they're big enough to know about these things because these problems are happening where they live.

options.label: D
options.text: They said that they don't care about issues of equity and that it's not their problem.
